text:
Malignant thoughts swirl in his mind.

In a cramped, yellow room, he lies awake.  
His heart pounds; his mind races.  

“Enough of this!” he exclaims, suddenly rising.  
“I need space! I need freedom!”  

---

On the street, he strides confidently.  
Muttering to himself, he feels alive.  
Passers-by stare, mistaking him for drunk.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov, feeling stifled and in turmoil, leaves his cramped room to walk aimlessly while muttering to himself.
